climbs.name: Skyy Pilot
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Lisa Guindon & Rocky Smith, June 2001

content.description: The crux comes early on this route as you pass the first bolt via some awkward moves, but higher the angle kicks back and easy slabbin' leads to the anchors - a true one-move wonder route.
content.protection: 4 bolts, chain anchors (shared with Naughty Pine)
content.location:
This is the second route from the left and is located just right of

Naughty Pine

and left of a wide crack/break in the wall which can be used as a downclimb.

content.description: Start at twin cracks, either low and on the right (5.9) or on the left (5.4), and then continue up an easy left-facing corner, move left into another left-facing corner and finish at anchors on a ledge.
content.location:
Just right of

Firewater

at twin cracks.

climbs.name: Naughty Pine
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Rocky Smith, Lisa Guindon, June 2001

content.description: Naughty Pine is a four bolt route that takes the face just right of a right facing flake on Skyy Slab. Use the face and lieback flake (2 bolts) to gain the upper slab for two more bolts to a shared anchor with Skyy Pilot.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 bolt chain anchor (shared with Skyy Pilot)
content.location: This is the farthest left route on the Skyy Slab.

content.description: Climbs a nice lieback flake/crack to face that's somewhat hidden owing to it's location.
content.protection: Gear to 2.5". chain anchors (shared with Here's Mud in Your Eye)
content.location:
Far right side of the face and across from

Shoot at Will

.

content.description: This seldom done rotue climbs a dirty and somewhat awkward left-facing corner system to finish on the ledge with the slab routes just to the right.
content.protection:
Gear to 2.5", chain anchors (shared with

A Midsummer's Night Seam

, Firewater and Rotgut)
content.location:
Just left of

A Midsummer's Night Seam

.

content.description: A steep start leads to a wild lieback and tricky moves over the lip of an overhang. Once established on the slab above easy moves lead up featured rock to the anchors.
content.protection: TR (anchors shared with Master of Cylinders)
content.location:
Between

Rotgut

and

Master of Cylinders

.

content.description: Well-protected, fun moves up the low-angled slab past 3 bolts make this an ideal beginner route, along with the other routes in the immediate vicinity.
content.protection:
3 bolts, chain anchors (shared with

A Midsummer's Night Seam

and Liquid Courage)
content.location:
This is the short slab just right of

A Midsummer's Night Seam

.

content.description: Enjoyable slab climbing along a faint seam leads to a crux just past the last bolt, where you must trust the rubber and go for it. Most of the route is fairly mild which makes this route (and the others on this wall) good for someone getting into leading.
content.protection: 3 bolts, chain anchors (shared with Liquid Courage, Firewater and Rotgut)
content.location:
This is the left of two bolted routes on the right side of the crag and is located just left of

Firewater

(5.5) an easy slab route.
